The thing that’s particularly interesting about both of these scenarios is that, after the expansion of the universe ceases, or after the universe shrinks back down, it will never change again.  There won’t be any more expansion or contraction, and the density of matter and radiation in the universe will never increase or decrease, ever again.  That’s a little bit like what we have now, when we’re outside of the expanding universe, and all of the matter and radiation in the universe seems to stay the same.  However, in the future, there will still be an “expanding universe”, which just means the distances between things like galaxies will continue to increase.
